reviews.review_msg: Although seemingly well meaning, she is extremely disorganized and not a competent professor. Her lectures are all over the place with students left scratching their heads after class. I will never take her class again. I highly recommend avoiding her as a prof.

Ivor Is by far my favourite prof I've had at SFU.  His eccentricity and energy make every lecture enjoyable.  He almost treats lecturing as an art form and therefore does not simply reiterate powerpoint slides as so many other profs do.  Exams are difficult, partially because he likes to ask a few obscure questions that you didn't bother studying.

Amazing lecturer and although he doesn't use slides, the way he present keeps you interested and listening throughout. Personally, I liked not having slides because I pay all my attention to listening and not copy-pasting slides as my notes. Don't miss class though because it is difficult to catch up and yes, he makes you work for a good grade.

Ivor is probably one of the hardest markers I have ever encountered during my University education.  However, he was one of the best.  If you want to get something out of school, take him!  If you're not studious though, go take someone else, you won't survive.

Best professor I've had at SFU by far. Challenging, informative, and incredibly knowledgeable, Ivor will push you to do the best you possibly can. I don't recommend his courses if you do not work hard for your grades or if you are uninterested at all in the subject. I recommend his courses if you want to learn from the best.

One of the most interesting courses I have taken, likely because of the effort and interest put in by Ivor, including articles published the same semester.Studying is a must but is a very fair marker.

Ivor is one of my favorite teachers at SFU, hands down. . .BUT!! This class WILL drag down your GPA if you don't devote your life to studying for his tests - He is THE hardest marker in the Geog department. However, he makes the course so interesting I would even consider auditing the class . . .
no text, exams are based on lectures he gives and on articles in reserve... pay close attention to pop stats... class average is usually around 40-50%, but will scale...
No Comments

The best prof I have ever had. He is amazing, it was a privilege to be in his class. He is very smart and you will learn a lot. His lectures are very dramatic and hilarious and intelligent. It's pure joy to hear his lectures. Sure, he's a hard marker but he's fair and he rewards excellent work. You just need to work hard in his class.

you can't get a better professor - clear, entertaining, hard marker no doubt, but grades on a curve - probably the most fair Prof on the hill - the assignment optional..and an overall interesting class...doesn't get much better.

Ivor knows his stuff inside and out.  His lectures were the most interesting that I've ever had.  Love the accent!  You will never fall asleep in one of his lectures.  His exams are tough, but if you study and keep your notes organized you will do fine.  I would definately recommend this prof!

Very interesting proff, the class would be boaring as hell without his excentricities.  Give the class chances to re-take tests, marks on a curve, has a million handouts and things to be photocopied instead of a textbook, keeps you on your toes, would be boaring without him!
Be well prepared for midterms/finals and map quiz
old school euro centric, and very simplistic

midterms are quite hard (I suggest you study in advance).  very picky in what goes into your essays on test(again, study in advance).  well organized lectures and seminars are pretty interesting but that doesnt dismiss the fact that he's a difficult "professor".
worst professor ever! teaching like an old freak player. not clear lecture. not organized. wonder how he becomes a professor at university

I find him a very interesting lecturer....although at times I find him extremely long winded. If you can take excellent notes and keep up with the reading, and not skip any lectures/tutorials, you should do alright. Sit in the front, you pay more attentio

Eccentric and somewhat traditional. Not easy... and can pick on students. SOcial skills not great, and seems too preoccupied with Geographic perspective. One thing that's good is that he cares about students developing their mind.
Marks every exam 2-3+ times.  Interesting man/prof; brutal marker. Good lecturer
weird guy....very critical.....
No Comments
Remember to bring at least 5 sheets of paper for each class, tought exam, funny
TOO HARD!!  If  you're looking for a easy class DO NOT  take this one!!
Interesting material & lectures well.  Exams: fair; Marking: brutal. DANGER!
